title.narrative: PH 2020 DtZ :To prevent and respond to OSEC and SECTT in Cebu province

description.narrative: The DtZ project aims to provide a comprehensive approach to promotion, protection, provision and prosecution of Online Sexual Exploitation of Children (OSEC) and Sexual Exploitation of Children in Travel and Tourism (SECTT) in Cebu province, Philippines. The Consortium will implement these through active engagement of children, families, communities, private sector and the government agencies in target areas through awareness raising activities, lobbying, capacity building and response to OSEC, SECTT and CSEC cases in its target areas.
Expenditure 2020

comment.narrative: Implementation of planned activities were scheduled only up to 3rd quarter. Actual expenses were excess against budget due to exchange rate loss.;
Limited mobility to reach out children because of COVID-19 pandemic.;
Targets for the year already achieved in the previous quarters. Most of the activities done were continuing and end conferences.;

The quarterly planned target set for the 1st quarter was 10 instead of 12. Other CSEC boys who received specialised services were old CSEC contacts. Only 11 out of 35 Boys who received the specialised services were new CSEC contacts.;

comment.narrative: Excess. We maximized the budget where it can still accommodate more.;
Implementation of planned activities were scheduled only up to 3rd quarter.;

Some activities were not conducted because of Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ) from April to May and later lifted to General Community Quarantine (GCQ) on June amidst COVID-19 pandemic. Expenses were on the salary of the staff.;

Trained boys are existing cases; The other activities are set to be conducted for the 1st quarter was postponed to the 2nd quarter due to enhanced community quarantine amidst pandemic COVID-19 crisis. Amount was utilized as direct cost of the project.;

comment.narrative: Additional number of girls provided with services by CLB.;
Excess of target for the quarter. More opportunities to provide free legal advise through the online legal assistance form.;
On-going interventions with old contacts with 7 new contacts reached. Actual expenses were excess against budget due to exchange rate loss.;

The quarterly planned target set for the 1st quarter was 10 instead of 12. Other CSEC girls who received specialised services were old CSEC contacts. Only 10 out of 39 girls who received the specialised services were new CSEC contacts.;

comment.narrative: Implementation of planned activities were scheduled only up to 3rd quarter;
No cost/budget allocated for this output as reflected in the Project Results Framework.;
The project has already reached its target from the previous quarter.;

The project has an overreached target of 2 meetings. This was because the meetings are relevant to the project and helped the team to respond to the issues and concerns experienced by the children beneficiaries and even the Project team.;

comment.narrative: Actually this is an over-achieved target. The indicated target output here is much higher than in the PRF.;
Excess. We maximized the budget where it can still accommodate more.;
Implementation of planned activities were scheduled only up to 3rd quarter yet Excess of target due to services continue to be provided.;
The realised outputs that are underachieved were the result of the cancelled/postponed activities due to the community quarantine implemented to avoid the spread of COVID-19.;

title.narrative: Meetings held with police and judiciary on CSEC

description.narrative: Meetings held with police and judiciary on CSEC

title.narrative: # of meetings held with police and judiciary

description.narrative: # of meetings held with police and judiciary

comment.narrative: 12 (of 20) Hearings of Cases were attended by CLB. The NGO targets 20 hearings per quarter as average hearing they have for their program. They are not putting target per quarter since they are putting target annually.;
All hearings are cancelled due to the lockdown regulations. Expenses were on the staff salary.;
Hearings on the cases handled do not stop and we are duty-bound to represent the clients and, at least monitor the cases. Actual expenses were excess against budget due to exchange rate loss.;
Not all courts have conducted court hearings.;

Shared expenses from Direct Program cost; The activity was already scheduled to be implemented last March 30-31, 2020 but because of the COVID 19 crisis, it was cancelled.;
